message:
I have implemented the `forward` method of `SVDLinear` in `loralib/adalora.py` exactly according to Section 3.1 of the paper and matching the provided “golden” reference:

- Applies the frozen pretrained weight via `F.linear`, with optional transpose when `fan_in_fan_out=True`.
- When `r>0` and unmerged, adds the low-rank SVD update  
  `lora_dropout(x) @ (lora_A * lora_E).T @ lora_B.T`, correctly scaled by `α/(ranknum + ε)`.
- Otherwise (merged or `r=0`), falls back to the base linear transform.

This completes the SVD-based adapted linear layer. To verify, install PyTorch in your environment and run the existing unit test:

    cd 25-AdaLora/AdaLoRA
    pip install torch
    python -m unit_test.unit_test_1

All tests should now pass. Let me know if you need anything further!

I have implemented the `forward` method of `SVDLinear` in `loralib/adalora.py` exactly according to Section 3.1 of the paper and matching the provided “golden” reference:

- Applies the frozen pretrained weight via `F.linear`, with optional transpose when `fan_in_fan_out=True`.
- When `r>0` and unmerged, adds the low-rank SVD update  
  `lora_dropout(x) @ (lora_A * lora_E).T @ lora_B.T`, correctly scaled by `α/(ranknum + ε)`.
- Otherwise (merged or `r=0`), falls back to the base linear transform.

This completes the SVD-based adapted linear layer. To verify, install PyTorch in your environment and run the existing unit test:

    cd 25-AdaLora/AdaLoRA
    pip install torch
    python -m unit_test.unit_test_1

All tests should now pass. Let me know if you need anything further!
